doc.after: In the 15th century the Renaissance spread with great speed from its birthplace in Florence first to the rest of Italy and soon to the rest of Europe The invention of the printing press by German printer Johannes Gutenberg allowed the rapid transmission of these new ideas As it spread its ideas diversified and changed being adapted to local culture In the 20th century scholars began to break the Renaissance into regional and national movements
